meanings.definition: To calculate again using a computer or calculator.
meanings.sent1: I need to recompute the total sales for the month.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recompute the budget to include unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: After the error, I had to recompute the numbers multiple times to get it right.
meanings.sent4: The scientist had to recompute the data to ensure accuracy in the results.
meanings.sent5: He had to recompute the recipe measurements to make the perfect cake.

meanings.definition: To reevaluate or reassess a calculation.
meanings.sent1: It's important to recompute the risks before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The team will recompute the project timeline to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: I had to recompute my chances of winning after hearing the new rules.
meanings.sent4: She had to recompute her strategy when the opponent changed tactics.
meanings.sent5: He will recompute his savings to see if he can afford the new car.
